channel.title: How to make everthing non-wildy but the wildy
channel.description: i need to know how to make everything non-widly but the wildy, ?? :confused:

item.title: How to make everthing non-wildy but the wildy
item.dc:creator: @pur3pk3r4 pur3pk3r4
item.description:
@pur3pk3r4 wrote:

[quote="_, post:4, topic:289302"]if (coordY >= 3520 && coordY <= 3967 && coordX <= 3392
&& coordX >= 2942) {
return true;
}

That makes a box, and in that box, it’s considered the wild.[/quote]

ok so thats only the wildy their?? i just want the wildy being not safe and everything esle safe

item.title: How to make everthing non-wildy but the wildy
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

if (coordY >= 3520 && coordY <= 3967 && coordX <= 3392
&& coordX >= 2942) {
return true;
}

That makes a box, and in that box, it’s considered the wild.

item.title: How to make everthing non-wildy but the wildy
item.dc:creator: @pur3pk3r4 pur3pk3r4
item.description:
@pur3pk3r4 wrote:

[quote="_™, post:2, topic:289302"]public boolean IsInWilderness
public boolean inwildy = false;
public boolean inwildy2 = false;

The list goes on.[/quote]
i did ctrl+f and looked for
public boolean IsInWildepublic boolean IsInWilderness(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) {
if (Type == 1) {
if (coordY >= 3520 && coordY <= 3967 && coordX <= 3392
&& coordX >= 2942) {
return true;
}
} else if (Type == 2) {
if (coordY >= 3512 && coordY <= 3967 && coordX <= 3392
&& coordX >= 2942) {
return true;
}
}
return false;
}
thats in my client.java and i only see one thing and thats this
